body_html: This is done, and should be out in git soon. tf.random_uniform now works for int32 and int64. Like the floating point case, it takes a half open range as [minval, maxval). In the integer case, maxval must be specified (it does not default to 1, since random zeros are not particularly useful).
body_text: This is done, and should be out in git soon.  tf.random_uniform now works for int32 and int64.  Like the floating point case, it takes a half open range as [minval, maxval).  In the integer case, maxval must be specified (it does not default to 1, since random zeros are not particularly useful).
body: This is done, and should be out in git soon.  `tf.random_uniform` now works for `int32` and `int64`.  Like the floating point case, it takes a half open range as `[minval, maxval)`.  In the integer case, `maxval` must be specified (it does not default to 1, since random zeros are not particularly useful).
